page.title: 18PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: {Mine Shafts }The area around Rhosesmor and Rhydymwyn is dotted with disused shafts,a reminder of leadmining from the past few centuries. At the old lead mine near Hendre Villas, the winding wheel is still in position. {Dismantled Railway}(Rhydymwyn)-used for moving local lead. It was closed in the 1960's. {Lime Kilns}-used for burning lime for fertilizer. {Ruby Brickworks}-built about a century ago, but no longer in use. Some of the kilns are still standing. {The Leete}(Rhydymwyn)-a "canal" built to provide water power for the old foundry and corn mill on its banks. {Wat's Dyke}-the remains of the barrier built to keep the Welsh out of Mercia in the 8th. Century. {Gwysaney Hall}-the hall and 2000 acre estate has been in the Davies family
